clips.Title: Signature
clips.Goal: Summarize the entire issue by illustrating an essential element of the story.
clips.Description: A strong signature photo will intrigue the audience and encourage them to look further. This element should fill at least 50% of the frame.
clips.Tip: Set your camera to Macro if you are shooting less than armâ€™s length from your subject.

clips.Title: Reaction/Interaction
clips.Goal: Depict how people are responding to the event or its aftermath.
clips.Description: Show the character interacting with others. Build a connection between the viewer and subject. Your character should fill 20% of your frame.
clips.Tip: Keep your character on one of the vertical lines to frame your shot properly.

clips.Title: Candid
clips.Goal: Show the character engaged in her environment.
clips.Description: Depict the character behaving naturally. Why is the character noteworthy? Show the audience.
clips.Tip: Place your character on one side of the frame, frame your shot to show something else important to the story on the other side.

clips.Title: Portrait
clips.Description: Your primary focus is the main character in your story. Highlight the characters emotions or state of mind.
clips.Tip: Use the eye-line to frame your shot properly.

clips.Title: Environmental
clips.Goal: Show where your story takes place.
clips.Description: Indicate the country or an ethnic or religious element. Include landmarks or other location specific information.
clips.Tip: Landmarks help the audience understand their location.
